# unicorn/no-instanceof-array <Badge type="info" text="Pedantic" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Require `Array.isArray()` instead of `instanceof Array`.

### Why is this bad?

The instanceof Array check doesn't work across realms/contexts, for example, frames/windows in browsers or the vm module in Node.js.

### Example

```javascript
array instanceof Array;
[1, 2, 3] instanceof Array;
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny unicorn/no-instanceof-array
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "rules": {
    "unicorn/no-instanceof-array": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
